programme.title: 2025 PGA Championship
programme.desc: Xander Schauffele carded a 6-under 65 over the final round to finish atop the leaderboard at 21-under 263 and captured his maiden major title and took home $3.33 million with his one-stroke victory over Bryson DeChambeau in last year's edition.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The winner of each regional advances to play in a best-of-three super regional round, with the eight remaining teams advancing to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Texas A&M, Oklahoma, Florida and Arkansas are the top four seeds.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Winnipeg avoided elimination with a 4-0 win over Dallas in Game 5 behind 22 saves from Connor Hellebuyck for his second shutout this series, the 50th shutout of his career, and two goals from Nikolaj Ehlers; Stars still lead the series, 3-2.

programme.title: College Softball
programme.desc: The winner of each regional advances to play in a best-of-three super regional round, with the eight remaining teams advancing to Oklahoma City for the Women's College World Series; Texas A&M, Oklahoma, Florida and Arkansas are the top four seeds.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: David Peterson (2-2, 3.05) allowed two runs or fewer in his last four starts; Max Fried (6-0, 1.11) is 3-0 with a 0.59 ERA in his last five starts, and is 9-5 with a 2.48 ERA in 23 career appearances against the Mets, including 18 starts.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.sub-title: Winning Time: Reggie Miller vs The New York
programme.desc: In the 1995 NBA Eastern Conference semifinals Reggie Miller became known as "The Garden's Greatest Villain," when he continuously broke the hearts of the New York Knicks, while leading the Indiana Pacers and waging a war of words with New York fans.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The New York Knicks, led by Walt Frazier, Earl Monroe, Willis Reed, Bill Bradley and Dave DeBusschere, would capture the imagination of New York City during a colorful and volatile era with their scrappy but dazzling style and amazing teamwork.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Michael Jordan is left to begin the 1997-98 season without his injured sidekick Scottie Pippen, whose contract dispute with the Bulls' front office reaches a fever pitch as the team gets off to one of the worst starts of its championship runs.

programme.title: Numbers on the Board
programme.desc: Four friends talk all things NBA basketball and provide their unique perspectives, breaking down results from the recent games, the latest news making headlines across the league and rumors making the rounds that could create waves.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Once a key member of the hated Detroit Pistons "Bad Boys" championship teams that brutalized Michael Jordan, Dennis Rodman is virtually all Jordan can count on in the early months of the 1997-98 season.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In what management insists is Phil Jackson's final season in Chicago as head coach of the Bulls, he continues to seem like the only one who can steer this unique, singular collection of talent to another title.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In the fall of 1997, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls begin their quest to win a sixth NBA title in eight years, but "The Last Dance," as coach Phil Jackson called it, will be shadowed by tension with the club's front office.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Joining the list of memorable defense lines with even more memorable nicknames in NFL history, Mark Gastineau, Joe Klecko, Marty Lyons and Abdul Salaam formed one of the most dominant defensive lines in NFL history for the New York Jets in the 1980s.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Portland and Seattle played to a 1-1 draw in their most recent meeting from the 2024 season on Oct. 19, where the Timbers' Antony Alves had the equalizer; Yeimar Gmez Andrade had given the Sounders a 1-0 lead in the first half of the draw at home.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: Shawn Langdon leads Tony Stewart in Top Fuel by 60 points, Austin Prock leads Paul Lee in Funny Car by 59 points and Dallas Glenn leads Greg Anderson in Pro Stock by 11 points following Charlotte, the fifth event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The All-Star Open is a 100-lap race around the .625-mile oval featuring drivers that have not already qualified for the All-Star Race; top two Open finishers and the top remaining vote-getter advance to the All-Star Race, which is a 200-lap race.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifications
programme.desc: Drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Indianapolis 500, as positions 13 to the back of the field are set with the top 12 advancing to the next day; Scott McLaughlin averaged 234.22 mph to win the pole last year before finishing in sixth.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Carson Hocevar secured his first Truck Series win of the season with a dominant victory at Kansas over William Byron; Corey Heim averaged 82.94 mph en route to his win at North Wilkesboro last year, beating Grant Enfinger by 2.474 seconds.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: NHRA Qualifying
programme.desc: The top drag racers in the country attempt to make the show through qualifying times in Top Fuel, Funny Car, Pro Stock and other classifications; the drivers who qualify with the fastest times advance to the elimination rounds.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (5-2) won its last two games after a 33-25 win over Houston behind quarterback Case Cookus; St. Louis (5-2) won three-straight games after a 19-9 win over Memphis behind two total touchdowns from QB Max Duggan.

programme.title: NASCAR RaceDay
programme.desc: RaceDay previews the All-Star Race, as a field of 20-plus drivers compete in the 250-lap race for a $1 million prize, going over the latest news from pit road and updated track conditions, along with their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Grant Holmes (2-3, 4.14) seeks his first win since April 20 despite holding Washington to one run in 6.1 innings on May 12; Lucas Giolito (1-1, 5.51) comes off his best start this season, holding Kansas City to one run in 6.2 innings on May 11.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The All-Star Open is a 100-lap race around the .625-mile oval featuring drivers that have not already qualified for the All-Star Race; top two Open finishers and the top remaining vote-getter advance to the All-Star Race, which is a 200-lap race.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifications
programme.desc: Drivers aim for the best starting spot in the Indianapolis 500, as the top 12 positions are determined through Top 12 Qualifying and the Firestone Fast Six; Scott McLaughlin averaged 234.22 mph to win the pole last year before finishing in sixth.

programme.desc: Defending Cup Series champion Joey Logano, who won his second All-Star Race last year over Denny Hamlin, and Ryan Blaney headline the field of 20-plus drivers competing in the 200-lap race at the 0.625-mile oval for a $1 million prize.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Michigan (5-2) won its last two games after a 25-24 win over Arlington behind a Toa Taua rushing touchdown as time expired, and won both meetings with the Roughnecks last season; Houston (3-4) had its two-win streak snapped by Birmingham, 33-25.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Portland and Seattle played to a 1-1 draw in their most recent meeting from the 2024 season on Oct. 19, where the Timbers' Antony Alves had the equalizer; Yeimar Gmez Andrade had given the Sounders a 1-0 lead in the first half of the draw at home.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Narrm (3-6-0) comes off a 91-56 setback to Hawthorn in Round 9; Brisbane (7-1-1) has won four of the past five meetings with the Demons, including an 86-81 victory last season in Round 16, as Hugh McCluggage scored a late goal from the boundary line.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The most talented bowlers in the world compete for lucrative prize money and coveted trophies, challenged by various lane oil patterns throughout the season, requiring bowlers to adjust ball angle, rotation and speed in order to succeed.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: South Sydney (5-0-5) ended its four-match losing streak with a 22-14 win over Brisbane on May 9; Wests Tigers (5-0-5) jumped out to a 12-point lead at halftime to snap a four-game skid to the Rabbitohs with an 18-16 triumph last season in Round 24.

programme.desc: The All-Star Open is a 100-lap race around the .625-mile oval featuring drivers that have not already qualified for the All-Star Race; top two Open finishers and the top remaining vote-getter advance to the All-Star Race, which is a 200-lap race.

programme.desc: Defending Cup Series champion Joey Logano, who won his second All-Star Race last year over Denny Hamlin, and Ryan Blaney headline the field of 20-plus drivers competing in the 200-lap race at the 0.625-mile oval for a $1 million prize.

programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Memphis (1-6) dropped its last two games since beating Birmingham, 24-20, on April 25 behind 235 passing yards and a TD from Dresser Winn; San Antonio (1-6) lost three-straight games, but won its lone meeting with the Showboats last season, 20-19.

programme.desc: Al-Ittihad claimed a 3-2 victory against Al-Shabab in the King's Cup semi-finals on April 1 behind a brace from Danilo Pereira in stoppage time; Cristian Guanca found the net with a brace for Al-Shabab to go up, 2-1, in the second half of the loss.

programme.desc: Landen Lewis cut his deficit to Connor Hall to four points after winning at Ace Speedway for his first win of the season, while Hall finished in 11th; Ryan Millington and Conner Jones rounded out the podium in North Carolina.
